error.msg: Boolean result is used in bitwise operation. Clarify expression with parentheses.
error.verbose: Suspicious expression. Boolean result is used in bitwise operation. The operator '!' and the comparison operators have higher precedence than bitwise operators. It is recommended that the expression is clarified with parentheses.

error.msg: Condition 'll<=8' is always true
error.verbose: Condition 'll<=8' is always true

location.info: Assuming that condition 'll<=0' is not redundant

error.msg: Redundant initialization for 'b1'. The initialized value is overwritten before it is read.
error.verbose: Redundant initialization for 'b1'. The initialized value is overwritten before it is read.

error.msg: Redundant initialization for 'b3'. The initialized value is overwritten before it is read.
error.verbose: Redundant initialization for 'b3'. The initialized value is overwritten before it is read.

error.msg: The scope of the variable 'magr1' can be reduced.
error.verbose: The scope of the variable 'magr1' can be reduced. Warning: Be careful when fixing this message, especially when there are inner loops. Here is an example where cppcheck will write that the scope for 'i' can be reduced:\012void f(int x)\012{\012 int i = 0;\012 if (x) {\012 // it's safe to move 'int i = 0;' here\012 for (int n = 0; n < 10; ++n) {\012 // it is possible but not safe to move 'int i = 0;' here\012 do_something(&i);\012 }\012 }\012}\012When you see this message it is always safe to reduce the variable scope 1 level.

error.msg: Cppcheck cannot find all the include files (use --check-config for details)
error.verbose: Cppcheck cannot find all the include files. Cppcheck can check the code without the include files found. But the results will probably be more accurate if all the include files are found. Please check your project's include directories and add all of them as include directories for Cppcheck. To see what files Cppcheck cannot find use --check-config.
